title: How does the Pixel 4 compare to the iPhone 11 and Samsung Galaxy S10?
text:
A display of the new Google Pixel 4 phones during a Google product launch event (EPA)

Google has revealed the latest incarnation of its Pixel smartphone series at a special event in New York.

The company revealed the new phone, which comes in two sizes, alongside several other new products at the annual hardware event.

The Pixel 4 and Pixel XL arrive with Android 10, the latest version of Google’s operating system, and impressive new camera technology. But the competition has never been stronger when it comes to buying smartphones.

Both Apple and Samsung have strong offerings in the form of the iPhone 11 and the Galaxy S10. So, how do they compare?

Here’s a handy rundown of the different phones and what they can offer.

Google Pixel 4

The Pixel 4 comes in Just Black, Clearly White and Oh So Orange (Drew Angerer/Getty Images)

Pricing starts at £669

5.7-inch FHD+ OLED display

2800mAH battery with “all-day battery life” and fast and wireless charging capabilities

Snapdragon 855 processor

Google Assistant built-in

Dual rear camera system including 16 and 12.2-megapixel lenses

Low-light Astrophotography capability

8-megapixel front-facing camera

4K video capture at 30 frames per second

iPhone 11

There are more colours to choose from if you go with the iPhone 11 (Apple)

Pricing starts at £729

6.1-inch Liquid Retina display

Up to 17 hours of video playback battery life with fast and wireless charging

IP68 splash, water and dust resistant

A13 Bionic chip processor with machine learning

Dual rear camera system including two 12-megapixel lenses

Low-light photography Night mode

12-megapixel front-facing camera

4K video capture at 24, 30 or 60 frames per second

Samsung Galaxy S10

The Samsung Galaxy S10, S10+ and the S10e (AP Photo/Eric Risberg)

Pricing starts from £799

6.1-inch Quad HD+ Dynamic AMOLED display

3400mAH battery with up to 18 hours video playback battery life

Wireless charging and PowerShare other device charging capability

Triple rear camera system including two 12 and one 16-megapixel lens

10-megapixel front-facing camera

Ultra high definition 4K video capture at 60 frames per second
description: Google's latest offering squares up to Apple and Samsung
